qas.question: Who patented an incandescent light bulb in Russia in 1874?
What did Lodygin use as a burner in his lamp?
In what year did Lodygin demonstrate a lamp at the World's Fair?
What did Lodygin change his name to after moving to the USA?
When did Lodygin invent his first lamp?
Who did not patent an incandescent light bulb in 1872?
Who did not demonstrate at the world fair in 1900 in Paris?
When did Anxander Lodygin change his name?
Who invented his first lamp in the 1700's?
What did Lodygin not use as a burner in his lamp?

context: In <a4_0>1872<a4_0/>, Russian <a0_0><b5_0><b8_0>Alexander Lodygin<b8_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/> invented an incandescent light bulb and obtained a Russian patent in 1874. He used as a burner <a1_0><b9_0>two carbon rods<b9_0/><a1_0/> of diminished section in a glass receiver, hermetically sealed, and filled with nitrogen, electrically arranged so that the current could be passed to the second carbon when the first had been consumed. Later he lived in the USA, changed his name to <a3_0><b6_0>Alexander de Lodyguine<b6_0/><a3_0/> and applied and obtained patents for incandescent lamps having chromium, iridium, rhodium, ruthenium, osmium, molybdenum and tungsten filaments, and a bulb using a molybdenum filament was demonstrated at the world fair of <a2_0><b7_0>1900<b7_0/><a2_0/> in Paris.
